column4: is there a way to install a RPM under Ubuntu (Apparently the java plugin Ubuntu has doesn't work , I have websites still telling me to install JRE and giving me this .rpm)
Not a goot idea to alien an rpm
the RPM is from java.com
It does not matter where it came from.
http://java.com/en/download/linux_manual.jsp
is there somewhere I can go in Ubuntu to try to mount usb devices that don't auto-mount?

there is an option in the menus for automounting removeable devices.. I have run across some usb's that are a problem.. but mostly it is when they are not properly unmounted from a systrem theat thay get locked down
it usualy does auto-mount them but this specific mp3 player goes straight to sleep mode when I plug it in to the PC Basicly PC zzzzzzz - zzzzzzz Mp3player
its also the first time I've plugged this one in
you can try sudo /etc/init.d/hal restart   to try and get a usb drive recognized..
will do
nope didn't make a difference
because of ubuntu lacking support for my mom's 2gb rechargable mp3 player she just got punked for my 1gb AAA battery mp3 player :P
most mp3 players have a mode that lets them look like a flash or removeable drive..  all of mine work.. 4 diffedrent ones
The ipod ones..  are a different matter
this one is a pretty cheap one so tis probably an issue with it
